intro: Plagiobothrys scouleri var. scouleri, commonly known as Scouler's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has hairy, lobed leaves and produces small, pale yellow or greenish flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
